intro: Linaria gharbensis f. purpurea, commonly known as the purple-flowered grasslinaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the Scrophulariaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale pink to deep purple. The foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Native to specific regions in North Africa, this plant thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
